quiz.text: ‘Laissez Faire’ a policy propagating non-interference by the Government is associated with which of the following?
options: Marxism
Capitalism
Socialism
Communism
Mixed Economy

quiz.text: Who of the following put forwarded the idea of introducing Gross Domestic Product (GDP) as an indicator of progress?
options: Simon Kuznets
Adam Smith
Karl Marx
J M Keynes
None of the above

quiz.text: Which Ministry of the Government of India is responsible for calculating Gross Domestic Product in India?
options: Ministry of Finance
Ministry of Consumer Affairs
Ministry of Commerce and Industry
Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation
Ministry of Education

quiz.text: Net National Product at factor cost is also known as
options: Net Domestic Product
Gross National Product
Gross Domestic Product
Personal Income
National Income

quiz.text: The aggregate production of final goods and services taking place within the domestic economy during a financial year, inclusive of depreciation is known as
options: Gross Domestic Product (GDP)
Gross National Product (GNP)
Net Domestic Product (NDP)
Net National Product (NNP)
None of the above

quiz.text: The total value of all the goods and services produced by the citizens of a country is called
options: Gross Domestic Product (GDP)
Gross National Product (GNP)
Net Domestic Product (NDP)
Net National Product (NNP)
None of the above

quiz.text: Economic growth in country X will necessarily occur if
options: There is capital formation in X
The volume of trade grows in the world economy
There is technical progress in the world economy
There is population growth in X
None of the above

quiz.text: What is obtained after deducting the total tax and non tax payments from personal income?
options: Per Capita Income
GDP at Per Capita
Personal Disposable Income
National Income
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following term denotes the average income earned by a person in India?
options: Per Capita Income
GDP at Per Capita
Personal Disposable Income
National Income
Real GDP

quiz.text: If the value of inflation is increased in an economy, then the nominal GDP
options: Increases
Decreases
Does not change
May increase or may decrease
It does not depend on inflation

quiz.text: Who is considered as “the father of modern economics”?
options: David Ricardo
Jean-Baptiste Say
Thomas Malthus
Adam Smith
John Stuart Mill

quiz.text: Which is the term Keynes used in ‘The General Theory’ to describe the instincts, proclivities, and emotions that ostensibly influence and guide human behaviour?
options: Animal spirits
Consumption atmosphere
Distribution temper
Production manes
None of the above

quiz.text: Macroeconomics emerged as a separate branch of economics, after the famous book by which of the following economists?
options: Adam Smith
John Maynard Keynes
David Ricardo
Henry Moore
Irving Fisher

quiz.text: Which of the following is wrong with respect to microeconomics?
options: It studies an individual unit
It deals with marginal analysis of companies
It focuses more on price analysis
It provides information about national income
It does not involve much in comparative studies

quiz.text: Which of the following are equal to one another in an economy? 1) Aggregate Production 2) Aggregate Expenditure 3) Aggregate Income Choose the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1 equals 2, but not 3
1 equals 3, but not 2
3 equals 2, but not 1
1 equals 2 equals 3
All are not equal

quiz.text: Which of the following are the function/s of a government in an economy?
options: Regulating monopolies
Income redistribution
Producing public goods
Promoting competition
All of the above

quiz.text: Household work and public services are classified under which of the following sector?
options: Service sector
Secondary sector
Primary sector
Quinary sector
Quartenary sector

quiz.text: Which of the following are examples of producer goods? 1) Petrol  2) Seeds 3) Tractor 4) Raw Materials Select the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1 and 3 only
2, 3 and 4 only
3 and 4 only
1, 2, 3 and 4
1, 3 and 4 only

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding ‘Services’?
options: There is no time gap between the production and consumption of services
Services cannot be stored.
Transfer of service is possible.
Services are non-tangible in nature
Goods are tangible and services are intangible.

quiz.text: The components of gross capital formation are
options: Gross fixed Capital formation
Changes in Inventories
Savings
Both 1 and 2
None of the above

quiz.text:
A product used to produce a final good or finished product is called ___________
  1. Intermediate good
  2. Durable good
  3. Semi-finished good
  4. Producer good
Select the correct code.
options: 1 Only
2 Only
1 and 3 only
2 and 4 Only
1,3 and 4 only

quiz.text: The base year which was used to calculate the first official estimate of national income is
options: 2011-2012
1946-1947
1947-1948
1948-1949
1950-1951

quiz.text: Which of the following is incorrect?
options: Net Investment = Gross Investment – Depreciation
Depreciation = Gross Investment - Net Investment
Gross Investment = Net Investment + Depreciation
Gross Investment = Net Investment - Depreciation
All of the above are correct

quiz.text: India has the target to achieve $5 Trillion economy, by which fiscal year?
options: 2021
2022
2023
2025
2024

quiz.text: While calculating GDP through income method, which of the following components are used? 1) Wages 2) Profits  3) Government Spending  4) Rents Select the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1, 2 and 3 only
1 and 2 only
2, 3 and 4 only
1, 2 and 4 only
1, 2, 3 and 4

quiz.text: Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is often calculated based on the "value-added method". What do you understand by the term "value-added"?
options: Difference in the costs of intermediate inputs and gross output
Difference in market price and subsidized price
Difference in export price and import price
Difference between earnings and taxes on the product
All of the above are correct

quiz.text: Which of the following sectors are taken into account for calculation of Gross Value Added in India? 1) Communication 2) Mining 3) Electricity 4) Agriculture 5) Real Estate
options: 1, 2, 3 and 4 only
1, 3, 4 and 5 only
1, 2, 3 and 4 only
2, 3, 4 and 5 only
All of the above

quiz.text: The difference between GDP at market prices and GDP at factor cost is
options: Direct Taxes
Net Indirect taxes
Transfer payments
Subsidies
None  of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements given is not correct?
options: Factor cost does not include any tax
GVA at basic prices includes the net product taxes but not net production taxes
Production taxes are independent of the volume of production
In order to arrive at market prices we have to add product taxes (less product subsidies) to the basic prices
All of the above  are correct

quiz.text: In an open economy, the Gross Domestic Product (Y) of the economy is: (C, I, G, X, and M stand for Consumption, Investment, Govt. Expenditure, total exports, and total imports respectively.)
options: Y = C + I + G + X
Y = I + G –X + M
Y = C + I + G + (X – M)
Y = C – G + I + (X – M)
Y = I + G –X + C

quiz.text: Which of the following is correct about National Disposable Income?
options: Gross National Product at market prices — Other current transfers from the rest of the world
Gross National Product at market prices + Other current transfers from the rest of the world
Net National Product at market prices — Other current transfers from the rest of the world
Net National Product at market prices + Other current transfers from the rest of the world
All of the above

quiz.text: With reference to ‘Real GDP’, which of the following statements is correct?
options: It measures total economic output produced valued at a constant market price
It is used for comparison across years and across countries
It concentrates on volume growth only and does not include price growth
It is calculated by dividing nominal GDP over a GDP deflator
All of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is correct?
options: Market Price > Base Price > Factor Cost
Market Price < Base Price > Factor Cost
Market Price < Base Price < Factor Cost
Base Price > Factor Cost > Market price
Base Price < Factor Cost < Market price

quiz.text: GDP growth caused by increase in the qualitative increase in land, labour, capital is called?
options: Extensive growth
Intensive growth
Primary growth
Secondary growth
Factor growth

quiz.text: Which of the following is correct with reference to the difference between Consumer Price Index (CPI) and GDP Deflator?
options: GDP deflator takes into account all goods and services produced in a country
CPI includes the prices of imported goods
GDP deflator does not include prices of imported goods
The weights are constant in CPI, but they differ according to production level of each good in GDP deflator
All of the above
